abstract.text: Decompresses a video frame.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The decompression session.
A
object containing one or more video frames.
A bitfield of directives to the decompression session and decoder.
The
bit indicates whether the video decoder may decompress the frame asynchronously.
The
bit indicates whether the decoder may delay calls to the output callback so as to enable processing in temporal (display) order.
If both flags are clear, the decompression completes and your output callback function will be called before
returns. If either flag is set,
may return before the output callback function is called.
Your reference value for the frame.  Note that if
contains multiple frames, the output callback function is called multiple times with this
value.
A
pointer to receive information about the decode operation.
The
bit may be set if the decode is (or was) running asynchronously.
The
bit may be set if the frame was dropped (synchronously).
Pass
if you do not want to receive this information.
An
value that indicates the result of the operation.

abstract.text: A reference to a buffer of media data.
Work directly with hardware-accelerated video encoding and decoding capabilities.
Flags to pass to a decompression session and the video decoder.
A flag that indicates to enable asynchronous decompression.
A flag that indicates to enable temporal processing.
Flags that provide information about the status of a decode operation.
A flag that indicates the decode operation ran asynchronously.
A flag that indicates the decode operation dropped a frame.
A reference to a decompression session.
Indicates whether the session can decode frames with the given format description.
Copies a black pixel buffer from the decompression session.
Decompresses a video frame.
Decompresses a video frame and calls the provided output closure when decompression completes.
Decompresses a video frame and invokes the output callback when the decompression completes.
Directs the decompression session to emit all delayed frames.
Waits for any and all outstanding asynchronous and delayed frames to complete, then returns.
Flags that indicate encoder state.
A reference to a buffer of media data.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
A raw pointer for accessing and manipulating untyped data.
